tit.e: Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (dispatching troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period)
tit.cmt: 「出兵」はローマ字で「shuppei」ではないかと思いますが、用語集に従いました。
tit.e: Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to the Hokuriku region in the Yowa period)
tit.cmt: Inserted "the", changed "dispatching" to "dispatch", inserted "the". I also prefer "shuppei" to "syuppei", but both are correct.
tit.e: Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to the Hokuriku region in the Yowa period)

sen.j: 養和の北陸出兵（ようわのほくりくしゅっぺい）とは、養和元年（1181年）7月頃から活発化した北陸地方反乱勢力に対する平家の追討活動のことである（養和元年11月まで）。
sen.e: Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (dispatching troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) was Heike's activities of tracking down and killing against the uprising power in Hokuriku region that intensified around September 1181 (till December 1181 or January 1182 (November 1181 in old lunar calendar)).

The Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) was conducted by the Heike in order to track down and kill the rebelling powers in the Hokuriku region, and intensified around September 1181 (ending around December 1181 or January 1182 (November 1181 by the old lunar calendar)).
sen.cmt: Inserted "The", changed "dispatching" to "dispatch", changed "was Heike's activiies" to "was conducted by the Heike", changed"of tracking down and killing" to "in order to track down and kill" changed "against the uprising power" to "the rebelling powers" inserted "the", changed "till" to "ending around", changed "in" to "by, inserted "the".
sen.e: The Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) was conducted by the Heike in order to track down and kill the rebelling powers in the Hokuriku region, and intensified around September 1181 (ending around December 1181 or January 1182 (November 1181 by the old lunar calendar)).

sen.j: 治承5年（1181年）6月の横田河原の戦いにおいて源義仲が平家方の越後国の雄城助職を打ち破る。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka defeated Sukemoto JO in the battle at the Yokota River in July or August 1181 (June 1181 in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka defeated Sukemoto JO in the battle at Yokota River in July or August 1181 (June 1181 by the old lunar calendar).
MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka defeated Sukemoto JO in the battle at Yokota River in July or August 1181 (June 1181 by the old lunar calendar).

sen.j: その直後から加賀国・能登国・若狭国の北陸豪族達が反乱活動を開始する。
sen.e: Immediately after that, powerful families in Hokuriku region including Kaga Province, Noto Province and Wakasa Province started insurgency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Immediately afterwards, powerful families in the Hokuriku region (including Kaga Province, Noto Province and Wakasa Province) began to rebel.
sen.cmt: Changed "after that" to "afterwards", inserted parentheses around "including Kaga Province (etc.)", changed "started insurgency" to "began to rebel".
sen.e: Immediately afterwards, powerful families in the Hokuriku region (including Kaga Province, Noto Province and Wakasa Province) began to rebel.

sen.j: 治承・寿永の乱以前から北陸各地では、延暦寺の末寺である白山神社の衆徒・神人たちと国衙勢力との間に対立が見られた。
sen.e: In various locations in Hokuriku region, the monk-soldiers and the jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) of Hakuzan-jinja Shrine, a branch shrine of Enryaku-ji Temple, clashed with kokuga seiryoku (the force of the provincial headquarters) even before Jisho-Juei War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In various locations in the Hokuriku region, the monk-soldiers and the jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) of Hakuzan-jinja Shrine, a branch shrine of Enryaku-ji Temple, had clashed with kokuga seiryoku (the force of the provincial headquarters) even before the Jisho-Juei War.

In various locations in the Hokuriku region, the monk-soldiers and the jinin (associates of Shinto shrines) of Hakuzan-jinja Shrine, a branch shrine of Enryaku-ji Temple, had clashed with kokuga seiryoku (the force of the provincial headquarters) even before the Jisho-Juei War.

sen.j: このように、国衙方と目される平家には以前から在地の反感を買う土壌があった。
sen.e: Thus, there had been a ground that the Taira clan (considered on the same side as kokuga) antagonized the local people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, there had been a preexisting feeling that the Taira clan (who were considered to be on the same side as the kokuga) antagonized the local people.
sen.cmt: Changed "a ground" to "a preexisting feeling", inserted "who were", inserted "to be", inserted "the".
sen.e: Thus, there had been a preexisting feeling that the Taira clan (who were considered to be on the same side as the kokuga) antagonized the local people.

sen.j: また、治承4年11月の近江攻防に若狭の国人が同意する動きがあるなどの反乱の萌芽がみられていた。
sen.e: In addition, Kokujin (local samurai) in Wakasa agreed to the offense and defense in Omi Province in November or December 1180 (November 1180 in old lunar calendar), which was a sign of insurgency.

In addition, there were signs of insurgency such as the agreement of the Kokujin (local samurai) in Wakasa to the offense and defense in Omi Province in November or December 1180 (November 1180 by the old lunar calendar).

In addition, there were signs of insurgency such as the agreement of the Kokujin (local samurai) in Wakasa to the offense and defense in Omi Province in November or December 1180 (November 1180 by the old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 養和元年（1181年）7月後半頃、加賀・能登で反乱の動きが起こり、それは越前国へと波及した。
sen.e: In the latter half of September 1181, a move of insurgency broke out in Kaga and Noto, and the it spread to Echizen Province.
In the latter half of September 1181, a rebellion broke out in Kaga and Noto, and spread to Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: Changed "a move of insurgency" to "a rebellion", removed "the it".
sen.e: In the latter half of September 1181, a rebellion broke out in Kaga and Noto, and spread to Echizen Province.

sen.j: これに対して平家は横田河原の戦いで破れた城資職を越後国司に任じる。
sen.e: Dealing with this, the Taira clan appointed Sukemoto JO, who had been defeated in the battle at the Yokota River, as the provincial governor of Echigo Province.
In response, the Taira clan appointed Sukemoto JO, who had been defeated in the battle at Yokota River, as the provincial governor of Echigo Province.
sen.cmt: Changed "Dealing with this" to "In response", removed "the".
sen.e: In response, the Taira clan appointed Sukemoto JO, who had been defeated in the battle at Yokota River, as the provincial governor of Echigo Province.

sen.j: ついで、8月平通盛・平経正が追討使として北陸に出陣する（『吉記』）。
sen.e: Following this, TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Tsunemasa departed for Hokuriku as the envoy to search and kill in September of October (August in old lunar calendar) ("Kikki" (a diary of Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).

Following this, TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Tsunemasa departed for Hokuriku as envoys for the search and kill expedition in September or October (August by the old lunar calendar) ("Kikki" (a diary by Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).
sen.cmt: Changed "envoy" to "envoys", changed "to search and kill" to "for the search and kill expedition", changed "of" to "or", changed "in" to "by the", changed "of" to "by".
sen.e: Following this, TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Tsunemasa departed for Hokuriku as envoys for the search and kill expedition in September or October (August by the old lunar calendar) ("Kikki" (a diary by Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).

sen.j: 通盛は越前国国府に入るが、越前・加賀の住人は従わず、9月6日水津にて反乱勢力と通盛との間に戦闘が行なわれる。
sen.e: Michimori entered the provincial capital of Echizen Province, but residents of Echizen and Kaga did not obey him, and on October 22, a war broke out between the uprising power and Michimori at Suizu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Michimori entered the provincial capital of Echizen Province, but the residents of Echizen and Kaga did not obey him, and on October 22, a war broke out between the rebel forces and Michimori at Suizu.

Michimori entered the provincial capital of Echizen Province, but the residents of Echizen and Kaga did not obey him, and on October 22, a war broke out between the rebel forces and Michimori at Suizu.

sen.j: そして、敗れた通盛は越前国府を追われて敦賀城に退却することになる。
sen.e: Having been defeated, Michimori pulled back to Tsuruga-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Defeated, Michimori retreated to Tsuruga-jo Castle.
Defeated, Michimori retreated to Tsuruga-jo Castle.

sen.j: さらに通盛は敦賀城をも追われる。
sen.e: Further, Michimori was ousted from Tsuruga-jo Castle.
Michimori was then ousted from Tsuruga-jo Castle.
Michimori was then ousted from Tsuruga-jo Castle.

sen.j: このとき若狭国に平経正も滞在していたが経正の援軍はなかった。
sen.e: Although TAIRA no Tsunemasa was staying Wakasa Province, there were no reinforcements from Tsumenasa.
Although TAIRA no Tsunemasa was staying in Wakasa Province, he sent no reinforcements.
sen.cmt: Inserted "in", changed "there were no reinforcements from Tsunemasa" to "he sent no reinforcements".
sen.e: Although TAIRA no Tsunemasa was staying in Wakasa Province, he sent no reinforcements.

sen.j: 10月には都で北陸の援兵の計画が練られるが実際には援軍は派遣されなかった（『玉葉』）。
sen.e: In November of December (October in old lunar calendar), a plan was developed to deliver enforcements, but in reality, enforcements were not dispatched ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane)).

In November or December (October by the old lunar calendar), a plan was developed to deliver reinforcements, but in reality, reinforcements were not dispatched ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane)).
sen.cmt: Changed "of" to "or", changed "in" to "by the", changed "enforcements" to "reinforcements".
sen.e: In November or December (October by the old lunar calendar), a plan was developed to deliver reinforcements, but in reality, reinforcements were not dispatched ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane)).

sen.j: 11月2日平通盛は北陸の遠征に何の実績を上げることもできずに帰京する（『吉記』）。
sen.e: On December 16, TAIRA no Michimori returned to Kyoto without having made any accomplishment in his expedition to Hokuriku ("Kikki" (a diary of Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).
On December 16, TAIRA no Michimori returned to Kyoto without having accomplished anything on his expedition to Hokuriku ("Kikki" (a diary by Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).
sen.cmt: Changed "made any accomplishment" to "accomplished anything", changed "in" to "on", changed "of" to "by".
sen.e: On December 16, TAIRA no Michimori returned to Kyoto without having accomplished anything on his expedition to Hokuriku ("Kikki" (a diary by Tsunefusa YOSHIDA)).

sen.j: その後平家によって北陸への遠征は計画がされるが大嘗祭の準備を名目に翌養和2年（1182年）の出兵は見送られ、寿永2年（1183年）に大遠征が開始されるまで北陸出兵は見送られることになる。
sen.e: Later, the Taira clan planned an expedition to Hokuriku, but dispatch of troops was put off in the name of the preparation for Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor), and it was ultimately put off until 1183 when the mighty expedition started.

Later, the Taira clan planned an expedition to Hokuriku, but the dispatch of troops was put off in the name of preparations for the Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor), and it was ultimately postponed until 1183, when the mighty expedition started.
sen.cmt: Inserted "the", deleted "the", inserted "the", changed "put off" to "postponed", inserted comma after "1183".
sen.e: Later, the Taira clan planned an expedition to Hokuriku, but the dispatch of troops was put off in the name of preparations for the Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor), and it was ultimately postponed until 1183, when the mighty expedition started.

sen.j: 当時、東海道・東山道も反乱勢力に制圧されていたが、北陸は平家の兵糧の補給地として大切な地域との認識があり、鎮西と並んで平家が反乱を早急に鎮圧しなければならない地域であった。
sen.e: At that time, although the uprising power took Tokai-do Road and Tosan-do Road under control, Hokuriku was the region as well as Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu), where Taira clan had to suppress the rebellion, because they recognized that it was an important region as the supplying place of army provisions

At that time, the rebel forces had taken control of the Tokai-do and Tosan-do Roads as well, but Hokuriku was recognized as an important supplier of army provisions, so it was this region as well as Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu) where the Taira clan had to suppress the rebellion.

At that time, the rebel forces had taken control of the Tokai-do and Tosan-do Roads as well, but Hokuriku was recognized as an important supplier of army provisions, so it was this region as well as Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu) where the Taira clan had to suppress the rebellion.

sen.j: そのため、北陸への出兵が最重要視されていた。
sen.e: Therefore, dispatching troops to Hokuriku was attached paramount importance.
Therefore, the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku was given paramount importance.
sen.cmt: Changed "dispatching" to "the dispatch of", changed "attached" to "given".
sen.e: Therefore, the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku was given paramount importance.

sen.j: なお、後年の編纂物である『吾妻鏡』などには一連の北陸出兵が「義仲討伐の為」と記されているが、当時の記録には、『玉葉』寿永2年（1183年）5月16日条まで義仲の名前は記載されていない。
sen.e: The books compiled in later years including "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) state that the serial dispatch of troops to Hokuriku was 'for search and kill Yoshinaka' but Yoshinaka's name was not recorded in the records made at the time till the entry of June 14, 1183 in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane).

The books compiled in later years, including "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), state that the serial dispatch of troops to Hokuriku was 'in order to seek out and kill Yoshinaka' but Yoshinaka's name was not recorded in the records made at the time, until the June 14, 1183 entry in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane).
sen.cmt: Inserted commas before and after the "including… East)" phrase, changed "for search and kill" to "in order to seek out and kill", changed "till" to ", until", changed "the entry of June 14, 1183" to "the June 14, 1183 entry".
sen.e: The books compiled in later years, including "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), state that the serial dispatch of troops to Hokuriku was 'in order to seek out and kill Yoshinaka' but Yoshinaka's name was not recorded in the records made at the time, until the June 14, 1183 entry in "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane).

sen.j: この養和の出兵ならびに寿永の出兵は義仲討伐という名目ではなくあくまでも北陸反乱勢力の討伐であり、北陸反乱諸勢力も養和の出兵の頃から義仲の配下にいたわけではないのである。
sen.e: Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (dispatching troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) and dispatching of troops in the Juei period were not on the pretext of search and kill Yoshinaka but to search and kill the uprising power in Hokuriku, and it is not that the uprising power in Hokuriku was under Yoshinaka from around the time when troops were dispatched to Hokuriku.

The Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) and the dispatch of troops in the Juei period were not to find and kill Yoshinaka but to find and kill the rebel forces in Hokuriku, and the rebel forces in Hokuriku were not under Yoshinaka's command from the time when troops were dispatched to Hokuriku.
sen.cmt: Changed "dispatching" to "the dispatch of", changed "on the pretext of" to "to", changed "search and kill" to "find and kill", changed "it is not that the uprising power" to "the rebel forces in Hokuriku were not".
sen.e: The Yowa no Hokuriku syuppei (the dispatch of troops to Hokuriku region in the Yowa period) and the dispatch of troops in the Juei period were not to find and kill Yoshinaka but to find and kill the rebel forces in Hokuriku, and the rebel forces in Hokuriku were not under Yoshinaka's command from the time when troops were dispatched to Hokuriku.
